snippet: Serena Williams wasn’t the least bit defensive about her lopsided victory in the quarterfinals over Carla Suárez Navarro — nor should she have been.
abstract: Harvey Araton On Tennis column holds that Serena Williams has no reason to be defensive about her lopsided victory over Carla Suarez Navarro in the quarterfinals of the United States Open tennis tournament; says a double-bagel beating, also known as love-love, is tennis' version of a perfect game, and no one should be expected to express sympathy for it.
lead_paragraph: Serena Williams wasn’t the least bit defensive about her lopsided victory in the quarterfinals over Carla Suárez Navarro — nor should she have been.

headline.main: A True Champion, Williams Perfects the Double Bagel
headline.print_headline: A True Champion, Williams Perfects The Double Bagel
